website_summaries.verdict: Basically a stand for smartphones or tablets combined with a document bed for scan targets, the ScanJig can turn your smartphone or tablet into a reliable portable scanner.
pros: Inexpensive way to turn select smartphones and tablets into reliable portable scanners
Breaks down and sets up quickly
cons: Can't adjust distance from camera to target to change field of view

customer_reviews.title: Bought the ScanJig Pro to improve my phone's document scanning ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the ScanJig Pro to improve my phone's document scanning. After spending a few minutes setting the unit up, I placed a sheet into position, put my phone into place and launched CamScanner. When properly adjusted there is plenty of leeway for making the scan. I have scanned 8x10 and smaller originals with success. Two issues: 1) I had to add a contrasting color to be sure to pick out the corners of the scan. 2) A costly solution, but one that works. Can't speak to the longevity of this as I've only had it for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect. What it needs is a series of holes ...
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect. What it needs is a series of holes in the shelf that supports your iphone so the apple headphones can be threaded through and attached to the bottom of the iphone. It's a little known fact that the volume buttons on the headphones act as a remote release even if you're using a different camera app. I positioned my iphone and drilled a hole through the shelf. Using the remote release my images are sharper.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Berman

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: The products works very well, my only complaint is you have to physically reassemble it every time you use it. It would be so much simpler if it simply folded up like a deck chair when you needed to use it.

customer_reviews.title: Once the initial set up was complete I found that this product was easy to use and does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 5-8 minutes to set up and position my device properly. It took another few minutes to learn how to use the cam-scanner app. Once the initial set up was complete I found that this product was easy to use and does what it claims. I could easily photograph documents and turn them into readable PDF's. It is a great product! I would highly recommend it!

customer_reviews.title: Great Backup Scanning Solution for iPhone, Android, or tablet.
customer_reviews.text: the ScanJig is about the size of a portable scanner and is well designed. this is an ideal option if you want to quickly scan documents without turning on your computer or dedicating a USB port to a scanner. I advise iPhone users to use the first or second set of holes for the shelf as instructed. The instructions are very thorough, and this device is a great accessory to any tablet or phone It works with KNFB reader. I recommend purchasing this device as a backup scanning solution or when traveling.

customer_reviews.title: OK but quite limited

One can't place the camera close enough to fill the iPhone camera frame because there are not appropriate side slots for placing the camera holder close enough. Odd and sad in a product that is this expensive.

customer_reviews.title: Way too expensive and very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Dealing with the company was fine, but the product itself was significantly less than fine. The scan jig is made of plastic-covered foam and the assembly is simply "insert tab A into slot B". The result is a very rickety product with very little structural integrity or durability. The same result could be accomplished with cardboard. As such, the price was astronomically high and the value was just not present. One star for this product is generous!

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced, particularly if you buy the book scan addition. The entire set up is light and poorly constructed. It works best if you are just scanning one piece of letter-size paper, but for all the other kinds of scanning it is a bad buy. Using an i-pad makes the stand unstable because the i-pad has to be located off center. The book addition does not allow the use of the i-pad at all--which is noted in the manual but not in the advertisement of the ScanJig Pro. If you wish to scan anything else, such as a large sheet of paper or a ledger type book, the ScanJig is almost useless.

There are slots to adjust the distance to the target area but they are about an 1 inch apart so the camera was either too close or too far.

product_meta.title: ScanJig Pro Plus - Document Scanning Stand for Phones & Tablets (iPad Pro) + Book Scanning Accessory. Helps The Blind, Visually Impaired, Fine Motor Difficulties
feature_bullets: WORK FROM HOME ACCESSORY – Scan documents, then email, copy, fax or upload to the cloud. The ScanJig portable scanning stand holds your phone or tablet in the correct position for fast, precisely aligned scans of documents, checks, books and photos.

NO NEED TO STAND OVER THE DOCUMENT – AVOID SHADOWS & GLARE - Work from a comfortable seated position with full access to your tablet or phone’s touch screen. The scanning stand’s patented angled design helps capture more room light, avoid shadows and reduce glare. Your camera flash is not required.
TABLET SUPPORT - Molded plastic parts provide firm support for tablets and phones. The ScanJig Pro model includes an extended shelf to better support larger tablets (e.g., iPad Pro 12.9 inch)

ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY – Helps the Blind, Visually Impaired, those with Fine Motor Difficulties and Tremors. This second generation scanning stand is designed to provide easy tactile and guided positioning of both your mobile device and document. You get correct alignment and field of view on the first scan.

IMPROVE APP PERFORMANCE - Just open the ScanJig, place your device, and start scanning in seconds. With built-in guides you can quickly scan up to 10 pages per minute. The kit includes a flat black matt sheet for automatic border detection when scanning photos or business cards. Also, paper stays hold folded receipts and letters flat while scanning.
